alert.note: Alert for Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 5:43PM EDT until June 03 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 542 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Summerville, Ladson, Knightsville, Lincolnville, Slandsville, Slands Bridge, Westoe, Cooke Crossroads, Dorchester Estates, Canaan, Orchard Hill, Stallsville, Oakbrook, Centerville and Summerville Medical Center.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
